ANOTHER PLEASE:
Ok... Niko was always a fan of 'speeding something up' - back when he was just a 12-year-old boy, he was trying to figure out how to speed up his internet speed and discovered a lot about ad-blocking and how it can speed up web browsing -- it was the dial-up days that gave him the initiative to find a way to do that.
When he turned 15, he tried messing with their home router and found an open-source project called DD-WRT, which unlocks the router’s potential to broadcast a stronger signal, manage network traffic, remotely access all your home computers, and a whole lot more.
